summary: Residency-trained pharmacist with over 29 years of clinical experience and over 25 years of healthcare informatics experience. I have led a corporate pharmacy team in the build, implementation, and support of a clinical pharmacy system across a large healthcare system in the Chicago area. I have experience providing clinical expertise in the sales cycle around the automated medication process including emphasis on medication distribution, IV workflow automation, and pharmacy operations. I continue to play an active role in pharmacy informatics within pharmacy organizations at the state and national levels, serving for over 10 years on various section advisory groups within the American Society of Health-System Pharmacists as well as serving as the chair of the Technology Committee for the Illinois Council of Health-System Pharmacists for over 22 years. I also volunteer extensively with the Greater Illinois Chapter of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society serving on the Board of Trustees for 9 years, serving as chair of the Chicago Lakefront Walk MS committee for 13 years, and raising money as a Gold Spokes top fundraiser in the Bike MS Tour de Farms since 2005.

publications.name: Inheritance and linkage relationships of nine allozyme loci in wild radish
Current State of IV Workflow Systems and IV Robotics
Optimizing automation and technology across a pharmacy enterprise

publications.description:
Purpose 
A standardized blueprint for use when harmonizing or standardizing pharmacy automation and technology resources across individual institutions or an integrated delivery network (IDN) of institutions is described.

Summary 
Whether to strive for standardization (use of the same vendors and equipment) versus harmonization (use of various technologies to meet patient-specific needs and organizational stability requirements) and how to coordinate activities across IDNs consisting of 3–30 or more hospitals are common questions due to consolidations in the healthcare industry. For most IDNs with legacy systems, harmonization may be the better option. Large-scale harmonization initiatives require significant planning and coordination involving all affected parties. Detailed project plans should include the compiling of all associated harmonization costs that involve human resources, information on ongoing services and equipment, and program schedules for multiple concurrent projects in order to provide a framework for planning and coordination. Part of the planning process for harmonization efforts should include an extensive current-state analysis that includes review of contracts and vendors. Final harmonization decisions should be based on a mix of vendor recommendations, best practices, and accommodation of current practices that result in the lowest complexity of system redesign with regard to existing systems. When harmonizing existing technologies, planning must also consider the impact of the change to both the organization and individual users.

Conclusion 
Harmonization is an evaluative process whereby process variation due to automation and technology variability can be reduced and organizational interoperability to meet patient-specific needs can be promoted.
publications.name: Harmonization of technology across an integrated delivery network

title.text: New Survey Reveals Patients Receive Too Many Needlesticks

message.text: More than 9 in 10 nurses in a recent survey agree that repeated needlesticks negatively impact the patient experience. They are calling for alternatives to improve care and workflow. Check out more survey results below. The time for change is now! https://lnkd.in/gKWa4Zxf #PatientExperience #NeedlestickChallenges #OneStickStayVision  #BDemployee

BD is proud to celebrate Nurses Month to celebrate the invaluable role nurses play in continuous healthcare innovation that helps drive forward the solutions that shape smarter, safer, and more effective healthcare.
BD MMS' Chief Nurse provides her perspective alongside other industry nurse leaders in the HIMSS Industry Perspective article, Nurse Innovation Digitizing Healthcare’s Future here: https://lnkd.in/g-zdpwUA

To nurses everywhere, thank you for dedication, compassion, and unwavering commitment to healthcare. Happy Nurses Month!  #BDemployee
